meanings.definition: Howling or wailing in a mournful or plaintive manner.
meanings.sent1: The ululant cry of the wolf echoed through the night.
meanings.sent2: The ululant wind made the trees sway in sorrow.
meanings.sent3: The ululant ghost in the story made everyone shiver.
meanings.sent4: The ululant siren of the ambulance pierced the silence.
meanings.sent5: The ululant sound of the violin evoked deep emotions in the listeners.

meanings.sent1: The ululant scream of the child startled everyone in the park.
meanings.sent2: The ululant whistle of the tea kettle signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent3: The ululant alarm clock woke me up with a jolt.
meanings.sent4: The ululant screech of the brakes made the driver hit the brakes.
meanings.sent5: The ululant cry of the seagulls filled the beach with noise.
